column4: does anyone know why mysql doesn't like my tunneled connection? can it see the difference between real localhost connect and tunneled one?
only the authentication is different
DMA ?
do i need to set it up for sata manually?
nope - sata is dma enabled by default
how full are these drives?
hmm what else could i check?
setting block sizes when you create the file system can help, but not 5x worth
the drive has more than 170GB free space but it always was like that, nothing that it got slower lately
check for badness in /var/log/messages.3.gz
check for badness in /var/log/messages
ok will try
i see no badness in message
what's your cpu ?
that box got X2 4600+
if you run 'vmstat 5' & leave it a 20 secs - do you see '0' in the 'b' column or larger numbers ?
oh let me try, sounds interesting
and even more 0s now...
0 is good
i will remember that :) what does it tell about btw?
that's the number of processes blocked waiting io
it's possible your puter was doing something else - try copying again, & run vmstat at the same time
oh i read you
